required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SHR-1701 Combined With Fluzoparib in a Single-arm, Extended Clinical Trial for Maintenance Treatment of Advanced Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma After First-line Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: SHR-1701 Combined With Fluzoparib in Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the trial was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SHR-1701 combined with fluzopar as a maintenance therapy after first-line treatment of advanced lung squamous cell carcinoma. Patients with advanced or metastatic (stage IV) lung squamous cell carcinoma have not received systemic chemotherapy and have measurable lesions (RECIST 1.1) ECOG PS 0-1. The patient received SHR1701 +fluzoparib

primary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the beginning of treatment to the first imaging disease progression or death (whichever occurs first)

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of subjects in complete remission (CR) and partial remission (PR) to the total subjects
Defined as the proportion of subjects with complete remission (CR), partial remission (PR) and stable disease (SD) to the total subjects
